result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oliver C Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oliver C Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Oliver C Smith.  Attorney Matthew Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Court notes that defendant has filed a number of pro se bail motions.
Court holds colloquy with defendant as to pro se filings; defendant has counsel and Court does not typically review pro se filings when represented by counsel.
Court reviews history of case and charges with the parties.
For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any modification to bail at this time.

Case remains scheduled for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Case is adjourned for bail hearing in Branch 28 on October 26, 2022.

Clerk:  jms

Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Oliver C. Smith - #2022006421, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Oliver Smith - #2022006421, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Oliver C Smith in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Oliver C Smith in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson and Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
State's motion to join cases for purposes of trial; no objection by defense counsel and granted by the Court.

Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial, jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Oliver C Smith not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Further, defendant has a pending case in Branch 16.

Discussion with the parties.
State may be pursuing joinder.

Court is willing to accept the Branch 16 case for global resolution, providing Branch 16 is willing to transfer the case.

Court orders this case adjourned for further scheduling conference in Branch 28.
Next court date parties to confirm whether all discovery has been received and possible scheduling of joinder motion will be discussed.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Oliver C Smith in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones; both appear by video.  Defendant Oliver C Smith in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Smith. Stipulation to the identification of the defendant and 20CF357& 22CF2029 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Oliver C Smith not in court, in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to the lateness of the hour Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, in person.  Gregg Herman appears in person the the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Jones just got appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Oliver C Smith in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Oliver C Smith in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oliver C Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25. AS TO COUNT 3:  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
